It's HALF-LIFE. Just Play it!

#Legendary

This game has a few iterations. There's the WON version of Half-Life which actually had a more caustic sound design which added a louder echo and more notible room reverberation differences which added to the atmopshere. It had a more stylized menu, loading screens and overall better action feel with movement. That is the game which I crapped my pants on and if you can get a copy I'd say it's better than the steam version which toned down the acoustics for the plebs. Half-Life Source is an abomination. It's a tech demo which does away with death-animations, visual consistency and the neat-touches of the original Half Life and all the kiddies go "MUH GRAPHICS" and forget the finer details which overall make Half-Life what it is. 

It has a long thought-out campaign with a lot of iteration and cool design decisions which contribute to this air of frantic survival against the odds and wondering if it'll ever work out. It was great as a kid and still is fun as an adult. 9.8/10

Pretty darn fun. Some excellent gaming moments with a few crappy sections (on a rail for example) and the game's difficulty options has always left me wanting more with playthroughs, normal is far too easy and hard is crushing, beating it on hard gave me many conniptions. But still a wonderful game that most skill levels can enjoy. (maybe with a cheeky bit of godmode for some harder sections if u find it challenging ; ) )

What an amazing game, truly a masterpiece.
An incredible storyline (yes, i am fully aware there aren't cutscenes or anything like that during the campaign) and atmosphere.
I won't dare to say it is difficult, but there is some challenge.

But let's start from the beginning:

Your name is Gordon Freeman and you are a scientist at the Black Mesa Institute, a research lab sponsored by the government of the USA, your task there is amazingly difficult for someone with a degreeat MIT: push a cart and press a button during a experiment and ultimately, the experiment goes wrong and aliens start dropping on Black Mesa to start an invasion.
You have to fight your way through the aliens back to the surface, just to discover that the government has sent Marines to kill all the scientists, so you have to go back to the lab and late in the game even into the alien world (but let's stop here for the sake of the surprises).

The gameplay, like the game, is an old fashion FPS, with armor and 100 hp, you can carry all the weapons you want, limited, VERY limited ammo and so on.
The graphics are obviously old, and they didn't aged very well, but come on, that's part of the charm of the game, who wants to play a game from 1998 with graphics from 20 years later?

Overall, I have only one thing to say or better to ask: WHY IN HELL ARE YOU WASTING YOUR TIME READING THIS STUPID REVIEW WHEN YOU COULD BE DOWNLOADING THIS FANTASTIC GAME? 






Side note: I bought the entire collection from the late year Steam sale, 8 reais (I am from Brazil, but I guess it was a little more than 2 dollars) for 11 games, so I recomend you to buy the collection if it is on sale. Personally it's one of the best games I ever played and the BEST SINGLEPLAYER FPS I EVER PLAYED (Battlefield and CoD aren't even close to this).



Well, considering you continue to read this review, who knows, by the time you finish this, Valve might ALREADY have released HL3? Who's with me?

HL3 OR RIOT!!!

solo edito esto para la insignia

This game is great. It mixes challenging puzzles, great game mechanics, an amazing story, and and refined gunplay perfectly. If you like puzzles, great storytelling, and fps games, than this is the game for you. And if you really want more modern graphics, than there is a sorce version. I highly recommend any steam user to get this game as it is a must have.

Well, well. I like to go into moderate detail when I review a game but there's not much I can add to when the game is regarded as one of the greatest fps games of all time and famous for being the aspirations of every fps after its release. I will also add that it was released over 19 years ago. Despite all this, I will review it as I normally would but with the fact in mind that the reader can appreciate an old game.

Graphics:

The graphics are obviously outdated, it looks between the quality of the Playstation and the Playstation 2. It has a somewhat pleasing style in my opinion and the graphics are sufficient enough that they clearly show you what everything is. if you see an object the graphics represent the object well enough that you can easily tell that it is that object and you can then infer it's properties. the only issue I genuinely had was the areas of the game where you are outside in the desert in daylight. the textures of the desert rock that is everywhere are quite ugly, it's quite messy, muddy and relatively low resolution, when in a bright environment and moving at the default fast movement speed it can hurt your eyes a bit. there are only a few of these sections in the game but they can take around 20 minutes if you are playing for the first time.

Sound:

The sound design is solid, everything has a unique sound and you can tell what enemies are around the corner if you are cautious and pay close attention to your environment. Weapon sound impactful enough to represent themselves, your footsteps change sound when you run or walk on different materials and the voices are clear and well expressed, you can always understand what the characters are saying at they match the assumed personality of a guard/scientist/agent.
Echoing and reverbs change depending on your environment although it is usually rather extreme and transitions harshly. I also personally think that the 3D sound balancing is a bit too extreme if someone is speaking to you and your turn slightly away from them you can bearly hear them in your other ear, just a nitpick.

Combat:

As priorly stated the guns sound and feel good, there's a good amount of recoil and the enemies react satisfyingly
(crumpling to the crossbow darts, Gibbing from the explosives and getting knocked back by the shotgun shells).
The weapons are very diverse between human and alien weaponry, long range, short range, explosive, projectile, hitscan and traps. The occasional turret where it makes sense is always fun. 
As for the enemies, the human military has some surprisingly complex AI. they try to flank you, force you out of cover with a generous number of grenades, they also appear to communicate with each other, telling their comrades when to move in or to fall back (comically to one scientist in a hazard suit). There have been a few occasions where they make unintelligent decisions and they can be exploited with a few methods.
The aliens are more animalistic and less tactical, as they should be.

Bosses are few and far between or very regular (depending on what you count as a boss), the final fight is irrefutably a boss and it handles quite well with a large amount of challenge to almost exclusively a first-time player. 

The levels:

Each level/chapter has a theme, almost always a significant fight, a new enemy or a new weapon. the levels mostly make sense and are well designed with hidden paths with rewards and multiple paths to take and loop back to. The puzzles are quite simple and make use of the environment and some forward thinking. Ammo was not in abundance (aside from the exception of the submachinegun bullets) this will force you to use guns you wouldn't otherwise, especially if you play on hard difficulty or if you are not very experienced with first-person shooters.

Replayability:

I have played this game several times over (as well as Half-Life: Sorce (i recommend the standard half-life over source)) and this game is always fun to play in my experience, even if you know what's ahead. my first playthrough took me about 16.5 hours so its great in length for how cheap this game is on sale and in the half-life or valve bundle. I also recommend checking out the expansions blue shift and opposing force.

It's good, you knew that, now you know a bit more on why it is.

this good game

First off, I like this game, I really do, that being said, this game is overrated in my opinion. The game has fun combat, nice atmosphere, and remains highly playable. It also has annoying "puzzles", bullet sponge enemies, wretched platforming, and has some cheap difficulty spikes. I think it is an FPS that any fan should play at least once, and then you can judge it against your personal tastes. My opinion is that while it is a game that deserves it's reputation as a classic, it is also put to shame by games that it inspired, as they managed to balance a compelling narrative against good gameplay that this game sadly couldn't manage to do. I think it is good, but has just been vastly overrated as a whole, but it's influence is undeniable.

English: (translator used) 
This game is known by everyone, because Counter Strike itself came out of it.
It divides into two completely different parts. They are unexpectedly single player and multiplayer.
Singleplayer:
The story of the singleplayer is totally unforgettable. Gordon Freeman was sent to Black Mesa to move a cart with a gem or what it is. This will all go wrong and you will be forced to fight the monsters and later the soldiers. Definitely one of the best, maybe the best story I've ever played.
Multiplayer:
He's just like a single-player, just playing the same weapons. Multiplayer is played in the form of deathmatche. The game is very fast and you do not have time for anything. The best weapon is probably a shotgun, but learning how to use this weapon is quite difficult. The shotgun can kill the head even for a relatively long distance. Moreover, getting closer to the opponent is quite easy due to the speed of the game. At this point, there is a problem with the shotgun. The effect is usually only when the shot is in the head and that is very, but really very difficult in the speed of the game. Anyway, if you learn this quote in quotes and you can hit your opponent's head, you will be in great advantage. If you get a shotgun too simple you can try to hit your head with a revolver. The revolver also kills the head for one shot, but killing is much harder because of his slow shooting. In addition, when shooting only one shell (revolver) is logically less likely than hitting your head with multiple shotguns. I do not recommend the revolver much. Just so I can sometimes take a fun game against a weaker opponent, no matter what you are. Anyway, surely, the revolver does not match the shotgun.
I did not find any bigger bug in Half-Life, except for a little bug in the single-player texture. The game is 10/10.

Such a classic.

Tough as nails and sometimes difficult to find out where to go, but that's all part of this game's enjoyment factor. Truly one of the greatest FPS' of its time, and this game would be a great hit with fans of the FPS genre.

I hope some day we are endowed with Half Life 3! XD

After 10 years finally i got this game! Back then my computer broke so i wait till I can buy, but i do recommend buy during the summer or winter sale and get the valve complete pack. 

I will still be happy to play this game over and over again! 11/10 recommended
